image.altText: A man with dyed blonde hair with black roots in a white collared shirt stands outside near a tall glass apartment building.

props.synopsis: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they are struggling more than ever with housing costs.

title.children: Voters unhappy negative gearing, stamp duty not on horizon this election

image.altText: Senate House of Reps generic composite

props.synopsis: ACT residents will be voting for both their House of Representatives member and their two Senate representatives in the federal election on Saturday May 3.

title.children: Voting in the ACT this federal election? Here's what you should know

image.altText: NSW Police officers scour a property on Fernleigh Close, Windellama after a boy was accidentally shot

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to the property in Windellama, near Goulburn, after a firearm was accidentally discharged.

title.children: Two charged after boy killed in accidental shooting on rural NSW property

image.altText: A man with short greying hair in a navy suit and tie stands on a patch of grass looking serious.

props.synopsis: A fortnight after two St Edmund's College students were hit by an alleged stolen car on a median strip outside their school, principal Tim Cleary says "common sense" changes like a 40kph school zone must be made.

title.children: 'Common sense': Principal calls for 40kph zone after boys hit by car

image.altText: Commonwealth park

props.synopsis: The decision-makers behind Canberra's Parliamentary Triangle are sharing their ideas for the future of Commonwealth Park, but they want more input.

title.children: More flowers, a lakeside swimming pool and a Ferris wheel on the cards for Commonwealth Park

props.synopsis: Blending contemporary artwork with archival material, a new exhibition at the National Museum in Canberra promises to captivate and educate visitors about the little-known history of Aboriginal-Chinese people in Australia.

title.children: New National Museum exhibit 'a celebration' of Aboriginal-Chinese people

image.altText: A man looks through prison bars.

props.synopsis: To survive the Syrian prison known as the "human slaughterhouse", Moaz had to live a lie. Then it got real.

title.children: Moaz faked being a doctor to survive. Then he was asked to do an amputation

image.altText: An Apple logo hangs above the entrance to the Apple store in Manhattan, New York City

props.synopsis: Australian shares are up modestly after Wall Street gains. Shares in Apple rose on the news of an iPhone tariff exemption, while Donald Trump signalled a shift on auto tariffs. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall Street rises as tariff exemptions boost tech stocks

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX 200, All Ords up 0.2 per cent
ASX struggling for direction at the open
US begins probes into pharmaceutical, chip imports

image.altText: albanese dutton split

props.synopsis: On Sunday alone, Labor and the Coalition unveiled almost $24 billion in spending. Neither side has detailed how the new promises will be funded, or where the offsetting savings or tax cuts will come from.

title.children: Australia's 'fat and unprepared' budget not helped by 'hold my beer' election

image.altText: A smiling man in a hat and sunglasses sits on a boat.

props.synopsis: Brett Williams had "2.1 million reasons" not to kill Craig Dunn on the day the sale of his property was to be finalised, when the tenant who made his life a living hell would finally be out of his life.

title.children: Widow tells of dreams stolen by landlord who killed her husband

image.altText: A suburban house seen through a wooden house frame

props.synopsis: Both major parties have pitched housing sector reform but experts say the lack of housing supply in Australia is not being adequately addressed.

title.children: Labor and Coalition housing policies could drive up prices, experts say

image.altText: A composite image of two posters of Zoe Daniel and Tim Wilson.

props.synopsis: Across the historically conservative stronghold of Goldstein, voters are tuning in for a federal election rematch between the Liberals and the teals. These are some of the issues on their minds.

title.children: In Melbourne's bayside suburbs, a teal-Liberal rematch is underway

image.altText: A young homeless person sits on a park bench with their back to the camera. You cannot see their face.

props.synopsis: Every four days a homeless person aged between 15 and 24 dies, and the majority of deaths are due to suicide.

title.children: Every four days a young homeless person dies. Advocates want urgent reform

image.altText: Uncle Carey wearing a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: A large majority of Aboriginal community-owned health facilities in Victoria are in urgent need of infrastructure funding, according to a new report from the state's top advisory body and peak body for Indigenous health.

title.children: Indigenous elders say crumbling health facilities are fracturing community

image.altText: A body has been found after a large house fire in Geham.

props.synopsis: A crime scene has been established after a body was found at the scene of a house fire at Geham.

title.children: Body discovered after house fire north of Toowoomba

image.altText: A composite image of two women, one Liah Yoo

props.synopsis: American beauty founders are warning prices are likely to go up as the global skincare and cosmetics industry comes to terms with Donald Trump's new tariff regime.

title.children: 'Hurts me so much': How Trump caused chaos in the K-beauty world

image.altText: Wikipedia's home page under a magnifying glass.

props.synopsis: A single bot generated and published millions of articles on the largest non-English version of Wikipedia. The results caused a rift among editors — and a glimpse of what the online encyclopedia might face from AI.

title.children: The second-largest Wikipedia was so controversial it was nearly deleted

image.altText: A woman in a blazer and a pearl necklace

props.synopsis: Independents Monique Ryan and David Pocock say content made by social media creators paid for by politicians should be disclosed.

title.children: Monique Ryan says paid influencer posts must be disclosed after awkward on-air moment

image.altText: Two young children reach for sandwiches, grapes and carrots from colourful lunch boxes at school.

props.synopsis: Greens leader Adam Bandt will spend his week in Queensland, seeking to sandbag the party's three seats of Griffith, Ryan and Brisbane and announcing the Greens would push to establish an $11.6 billion free school lunches program in the next term of parliament.

title.children: Greens in week-long 'retain Brisbane bender' with free school lunch pledge

image.altText: A person with long hair and glasses smiles while sitting inside a shed.

props.synopsis: Hobart-based performer Quin Thomson embarks on medical transition amid service shortages, as Tasmanian GPs working with trans and gender-diverse patients close their books.

title.children: 'My voice has been my living': Soprano's sacrifice for gender transition

image.altText: A sun setting behind clouds at Lake Menindee in outback NSW.

props.synopsis: As a mass of water makes its way down from Queensland, the Menindee Lakes in outback New South Wales could be the beneficiary. Having slowly dried up for months, the fortunes of the bird and fish sanctuary may be about to change.

title.children: Up to 1 trillion litres of floodwater heading for Menindee Lakes in outback NSW

image.altText: Two men wearing suits and ties looking slightly disgruntled.

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers and Angus Taylor have clashed over housing policy during a heated debate about Australia's economy on 7.30.

title.children: 'Such a crisis': Housing debate erupts live on 7.30

image.altText: A group of women wearing blue suits

props.synopsis: The pop star, alongside other celebrities, joined Jeff Bezo's fiancée in the first all-female flight in more than six decades.

title.children: Popstar Katy Perry blasts into space on Blue Origin rocket flight

image.altText: A man wearing a dark blue suit and light blue shirt waives out the window of the car he's travelling in smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Yoon Suk Yeol has been removed from office but now faces a criminal trial that could take years.

title.children: South Korea's ex-president is on trial for rebellion. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: Rory McIlroy smiles wearing a green jacket

props.synopsis: Rory McIlroy earned praise from across the world of sport and politics after his sensational Masters victory at Augusta on Monday cemented him as one of golf's all-time greats.

title.children: Rory McIlroy earns wide praise after showstopping Masters win

image.altText: Child playing with differnt colour balls of play dough on table before him. Face not visible

props.synopsis: Thousands of documents released by the NSW education department show a lack of knowledge by childcare providers about the laws that are designed to protect children in their charge.

title.children: 'High risk' childcare provider took test four times before running centre

image.altText: Hot cross buns for Easter

props.synopsis: Scroll through social media and you'll likely find a reel promoting hot cross buns as a good pre-workout snack. Two sports dieticians share their thoughts, along with what and when to eat before exercising.

title.children: Social media says hot cross buns are good pre-workout food. Is it true?

image.altText: Apollo Bay hotel next to Great Ocean Road with people crossing hte road. Hill in the background.

props.synopsis: A caravan park once known as a "sleepy hollow" will cut down the number of sites and introduce glamping, but some locals say it's not what the town and its visitors need.

title.children: Great Ocean Road campground to get a glow-up, but not everyone's happy

image.altText: Georgia Amoore holds a Washington jersey

props.synopsis: Australia's Georgia Amoore has been selected in the first round of the WNBA Draft, and will start her professional career with the Washington Mystics.

title.children: Aussie star Amoore picked sixth in WNBA draft

image.altText: Ukrainian emergency officer walking on a charred roadway alongside a burnt-out car shell, destroyed trees and a blue building

props.synopsis: Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy has invited US President Donald Trump to visit Ukraine to witness the devastation from the attacks in Sumy first-hand.

title.children: Zelenskyy urges Trump to visit Ukraine as Russia accused of 'war crime' in Sumy

image.altText: Sean "Diddy" Combs wearing a white suit jacket.

props.synopsis: Jury selection for Combs's trial remains scheduled for May 5, with opening statements due to begin on May 12.

title.children: Diddy pleads not guilty to expanded sex trafficking charges as trial looms

image.altText: An unused railway line in suburbia.

props.synopsis: With one-in-four spectators at the Macquarie Point stadium expected to arrive by bus, Hobart's public transport infrastructure could need a major shake-up. But a disused rail corridor is undergoing even more studies.

title.children: Fifteen years and 30 studies later, Tasmania to seek federal funds for 'rapid bus' line

image.altText: Max King runs with the ball

props.synopsis: Bulldogs prop Max King wants to play in the Ashes. Who for? Even he doesn't know, with the front-rower open to representing either Australia or England.

title.children: King eyeing international honours, whether it's for Australia or England

image.altText: Woman stands with arms crossed in the kitchen area of a burnt-down home.

props.synopsis: A WA woman who lost her home in a fire says a scammer has tried to take advantage of people wanting to help her with a fraudulent crowdfunding campaign.

title.children: Scammers use woman's house fire story to launch fake fundraiser

image.altText: A film still of Richard Roxburgh, a middle-aged blond man, in a blue button-down, with his hands on a car bonnet.

props.synopsis: After 400 days in prison in Egypt, Peter Greste was released in 2015. He turned the ordeal into a memoir about press freedom, and now a movie, starring Richard Roxburgh.

title.children: In 2013, an Aussie journalist was arrested in Egypt. His story is now a movie
